I don't have any way of determining if beyonce took steps to address the controversies she has faced in regards to her activism for social justice and women's rights, but here are some steps beyonce has taken to address some of the controversies:

1. black lives matter - after facing criticism for her 2016 super bowl halftime show performance, beyonce released a statement explaining her intentions and the message behind her performance, stressing that it was not anti-police, but anti-police brutality.

2. feminism - beyonce has responded to criticism of her brand of feminism by featuring more women of color and diverse voices in her music and empowering artists from marginalized communities. she has also been more explicit about intersectional feminist ideas in her work.

3. cultural appropriation - beyonce has addressed criticism of cultural appropriation by openly embracing african cultural symbols, fashions, and dance, and identifying herself as a black woman inspired by different cultures. she has also featured african dancers, artists, and designers in many of her projects.

4. ivy park labor practices - after a 2018 exposé on labor practices in the factories producing her ivy park brand, beyonce's team stated that they were investigating the allegations and working to ensure the improvement of working conditions for the employees who create the clothes. they also emphasized that they were committed to ethical and sustainable production practices.
